intro: Tilocarpus papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan tilocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Papua, Indonesia, where it thrives in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds, typical of the Annonaceae family. Tilocarpus papuanus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
